CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 18, 1946, pg. 2, reads: "Miner with Minors - Daniel Smith of Pricedale's Somers mine, like many other miners, has a large family. He and Mrs. Smith have sixteen children and numerous grandchildren.  Some of his children are shown here.  Mr. Smith didn't return to work Monday, although his local voted to return, because of an injury in mine.  He has been injured three times in his life in mine accidents, he says.  He has had a broken arm, broken foot, and bruised chest.  his son, Sgt. Jennings Smith, just returned from service with 366th infantry, suffered an eye injury once in the mines also.  They and other miners have definite opinions about the proposed Health and Welfare Fund. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Smith family, including Daniel Smith and Mrs. Smith, their son Sgt. Jennings Smith, and other boys and girls, gathered around wooden steps of their home
